summary: This document is an email chain from August 2008 discussing the filing of Jeffrey Epstein's non-prosecution agreement. It includes an internal note from July 2008 pointing out factual misstatements Epstein made in court regarding the Florida Science Foundation, including its incorporation date and physical presence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the non-prosecution agreement. The email notes he made misstatements to the court about the Florida Science Foundation, including its incorporation date and his daily work presence there.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: His office suite is listed as the address for the Florida Science Foundation, an entity Epstein claimed to work for. The email notes the foundation's name does not appear at that location.

persons.name: Marie
persons.context: Addressed in the email regarding the filing of the agreement and obtaining a transcript. Likely a court or legal administrator.

connections.description: Epstein's claimed entity, the Florida Science Foundation, used Goldberger's office suite as its listed address, suggesting a business or financial association.

events.title: Internal Note on Epstein's Court Misstatements
events.description: An internal email notes factual misstatements made by Jeffrey Epstein during a change of plea hearing regarding the Florida Science Foundation's incorporation date and his claimed daily work presence.

events.title: Email on Filing Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Email correspondence forwarding information about the filing of Jeffrey Epstein's non-prosecution agreement and noting that only the original agreement, not its addenda, was filed.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The non-prosecution agreement for Jeffrey Epstein was filed under seal, but an email notes only the original September agreement was filed, not its addenda.

An internal note from July 2008 highlights factual misstatements Epstein made to the court, including that the Florida Science Foundation was incorporated in November 2007, not 'a couple of years ago' as he claimed.
The listed address for the Florida Science Foundation was Jack Goldberger's office suite, but investigations found no signage or tenant knowledge of the foundation at that location.
The note contradicts Epstein's claim of working at the foundation 'every day,' stating he had not been in Palm Beach County in the preceding six months.
